nodes.bodyText: can we move this to common.sh so that jet script can use it too ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,6 +18,18 @@ if [ "${PROMETHEUS_PORT}" ]; then
     PROMETHEUS="-javaagent:${JET_HOME}/lib/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-${prometheus.version}.jar=${PROMETHEUS_PORT}:${JET_HOME}/config/jmx_agent_config.yaml"
 fi
 
+# Read jvm.options file

nodes.bodyText: can we note here that this should be used if you using Java 8?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+# JVM Configuration
+
+# One option per line
+# Lines starting with # and empty lines are ignored
+
+# Memory configuration
+#-Xms4g
+#-Xmx4g
+#-XX:+AlwaysPreTouch
+
+# Generate heap dump on out-of-memory error
+# Uncomment to enable
+#-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
+#-XX:HeapDumpPath=./
+
+# Enable debugger
+#-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=5005
+
+# Enable JMX
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9010
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.local.only=false
+
+# GC configuration
+
+# G1GC Configuration

nodes.bodyText: will this use JET_HOME by default?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+# JVM Configuration
+
+# One option per line
+# Lines starting with # and empty lines are ignored
+
+# Memory configuration
+#-Xms4g
+#-Xmx4g
+#-XX:+AlwaysPreTouch
+
+# Generate heap dump on out-of-memory error
+# Uncomment to enable
+#-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
+#-XX:HeapDumpPath=./
+
+# Enable debugger
+#-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=5005
+
+# Enable JMX
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9010
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false
+#-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.local.only=false
+
+# GC configuration
+
+# G1GC Configuration
+#-XX:+UseG1GC
+#-XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=50
+
+# ZGC
+#-XX:+UseZGC
+
+# Shenandoah
+#-XX:+UseShenandoahGC
+
+## JDK 8 GC logging
+#-XX:+PrintGCDetails
+#-XX:+PrintGCDateStamps
+#-XX:+PrintTenuringDistribution
+#-XX:+PrintGCApplicationStoppedTime
+#-Xloggc:logs/gc.log

nodes.bodyText:
Good point,
It would use the current directory, our tutorials expect that it is same as JET_HOME, but users may well be in the bin directory, or elsewhere.
I have added evaluation of the jvm.options file so we can use $JET_HOME there.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+# JVM Configuration
+
+# One option per line
+# Lines starting with # and empty lines are ignored

nodes.bodyText: It is much more useful when the GC logs are in line with Jet logs, though. But the only way to get it i guess is going through stdout.
